com.github.davidmoten.rx.jdbc

Interface ConnectionProvider

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    ConnectionProviderFromContext, ConnectionProviderFromUrl, ConnectionProviderPooled

    public interface ConnectionProvider
    Provides JDBC Connections as required. It is advisable generally to use a Connection pool.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void close()
      Closes the connection provider and releases its resources.
      Connection get()
      Returns a new Connection (perhaps from a Connection pool).

    • Method Detail

      • get

        Connection get()
        Returns a new Connection (perhaps from a Connection pool).
        Returns:
        a new Connection to a database

      • close

        void close()
        Closes the connection provider and releases its resources. For example, a connection pool may need formal closure to release its connections because connection.close() is actually just releasing a connection back to the pool for reuse. This method should be idempotent.
